hero.title: Positano to Sorrento — Ferry
hero.description: Take a direct ferry from Positano’s Spiaggia Grande pier to Sorrento. This short guide covers walking to the pier, where to buy tickets, boarding tips, and what to expect on arrival at Sorrento’s port.

cta.label: Tip
cta.copy: Need every transport option? Open the <link>How to Get Here overview</link> for buses, taxis, and mixed itineraries.

journeyOverview.title: Journey overview
items: Allow roughly 45–60 minutes dock-to-dock in season.
Ferries are weather-dependent and can sell out at peak times.
Buying tickets a little early helps secure seats and smooth boarding.

walkToPier.title: Walk to Positano’s pier
items: From Hostel Brikette, head downhill toward Spiaggia Grande (main beach/pier).
If carrying heavy luggage, consider booking the official porter service at the pier.
Buy tickets at the waterfront booths or via operators’ websites (for example, Travelmar or NLG).
walkToPier.note: Check times and prices on <positano>Positano.com — Ferry schedules</positano> and on the operators’ websites such as <travelmar>Travelmar</travelmar> or <nlg>NLG</nlg>.

boarding.title: Buy your ticket and board
items: Arrive 20–30 minutes before departure to queue calmly and exchange any vouchers if required.
Keep your ticket handy and follow crew instructions when boarding.
Place larger bags in the designated luggage area; keep valuables with you.

arrival.title: Arriving in Sorrento
items: Disembark at Sorrento’s Marina Piccola (ferry port).
Follow signs up to town or use local transport to reach Sorrento’s train station if continuing onward.
Check onward trains/buses in advance, especially evenings and shoulder season.
